page.title: 14RELIGION,SPETCHLEY AREA
page.content: {RELIGION }plays an important part in the life of the people of the area. The Berkeley family have been of the {Roman Catholic}faith since 1632 when the elder son ,Thomas, converted and was disinherited. As there was no other male heir, Thomas's Catholic son inherited the property and the family began to use separate chaplains and today , worship in their {own chapel}in the Hall. There is a Catholic cemetery where more recent family burials take place. Most of the estate's employees are of the same faith. { All Saints Church}is not used by the family,therefore and is a part of the united parish of{Peopleton,Churchill, {Whiteladies Aston.}Parish services in Spetchley take place in summer, on 1st and 3rd Sundays 11.15am and, in winter on 1st Sundays only.
